noun.name: scissors
noun.discription: a tool with two blades whose cutting edges slide against each other to cut materials

object1.name: pliers
object1.discription: in parallel with 'scissors', is a hand tool with two hinged arms and flat, serrated jaws for gripping and holding objects

object2.name: tweezers
object2.discription: in parallel with 'scissors', is a small tool with two thin, pointed arms that are joined at one end for picking up small objects

object3.name: knife
object3.discription: in parallel with 'scissors', is a sharp-edged tool used for cutting and slicing

object4.name: hammer
object4.discription: in parallel with 'scissors', is a tool with a heavy metal head attached to a handle, used for pounding and driving nails

object5.name: saw
object5.discription: in parallel with 'scissors', is a tool with a toothed blade used for cutting through materials

object6.name: wrench
object6.discription: in parallel with 'scissors', is a tool used for gripping and turning nuts, bolts, and pipes

object7.name: drill
object7.discription: in parallel with 'scissors', is a tool with a rotating cutting bit used for making holes in various materials

object8.name: screwdriver
object8.discription: in parallel with 'scissors', is a tool with a flattened or cross-shaped tip that fits into the head of a screw, used for turning it
